definition: to wither (and drop off)/to wilt/to pass away
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The ground is covered with stiff, dry branches which have rotted off as the trees die.
sentences.chinese: 地上全是硬而乾的樹枝，都是因樹死而凋落下來的。

sentences.english: Soon the leaves will be discarded, the grass will sere.
sentences.chinese: 很快樹葉將凋落，小草將枯萎。

sentences.english: The faded flower sighs that the spring has vanished for ever.
sentences.chinese: 凋落的殘花朵哀嘆道，春已永逝。

sentences.english: Not far fetched to say you love me, anyway, my soul has patches of litter.
sentences.chinese: 你也不必牽強再說愛我，反正我的靈魂已片片凋落。

sentences.english: One woman in a fading Japanese village is slowly replacing its dead residents with scarecrows.
sentences.chinese: 正在凋落的日本村莊中，一位婦人用布偶重現舊人。

sentences.english: What if my leaves are falling like its own!
sentences.chinese: 就算是我的每一片葉子都會凋落又有什麼呢？

sentences.english: For many in South Korea, the flower has already fallen.
sentences.chinese: 對很多韓國人來說，這朵花已經凋落了。

sentences.english: Warming and nitrogen deposition had significantly effect on phosphorus content of litter.
sentences.chinese: 增溫和施氮對羊草和蘆葦凋落物含磷量影響均顯著。

sentences.english: She was in severe winter and spring in March.
sentences.chinese: 她在寒冬臘月奔放，又在陽春三月凋落。

sentences.english: Protects not the old myth and the fable together, never withers and falls.
sentences.chinese: 一起守護不老的神話和傳說，永不凋落。

sentences.english: Fallowing played an important role in the early litter production and nutrients accumulation on sand land.
sentences.chinese: 撂荒具有較早歸還凋落物和增加土壤養分的能力。

sentences.english: The flowers were choked by weeds.
Is everything coming to fruition or to wither without anything?
sentences.chinese: 到底是瓜熟地落還是枯黃凋落？

sentences.english: Autumn leaves that are golden today are often gone tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 秋天的葉子今天還是金黃，明天可能就凋落了。

sentences.english: Full of emotion, will be the time to fill, and I will eventually learn relief.
sentences.chinese: 凋落的情感，終將被時間填滿，而我終將學懂釋然。
美貌像一朵花一樣凋落。

definition: to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
(of a plant) to be in bud
variant of 枝椏|枝桠[zhi1 ya1]
